sect2.title: Log files: package logrotate

meta.name: description
meta.content: Learn how to manage system log files with the logrotate package, which controls their growth and storage in /var/log.

sect2.para: There are several system services (daemons) that, along with the kernel itself, regularly record the system status and specific events onto log files. This way, the administrator can regularly check the status of the system at a certain point in time, recognize errors or faulty functions and troubleshoot them with pinpoint precision. These log files are normally stored in /var/log as specified by FHS and grow on a daily basis. The logrotate package helps control the growth of these files. For more details refer to .
